key_points: The Menominee Casino Resort has been closed since Friday due to an attempted cyberattack on its computer systems.
Casino leaders are collaborating with the FBI and cybersecurity and forensics experts to investigate the impact of the attack.
The casino is expected to reopen on Thursday.
An IT worker identified an issue on Thursday night, leading to the confirmation of the cyberattack.
Despite the attack, no evidence suggests that any information was stolen from the casino's systems.
The casino emphasizes the importance of guest and worker privacy, vowing to notify individuals in writing if their information was compromised.
It remains uncertain how much financial damage the attack has inflicted on the casino, but it is expected to be substantial.
The motive behind the attack appears to be an attempt to shut down the casino.
Daniel Hanson, general manager of Menominee Casino Resort, promises transparency and immediate communication if new information arises.
The incident is part of a larger trend, with ransomware attacks targeting various businesses and infrastructure across the country.
spokespersons: Daniel Hanson (General Manager, Menominee Casino Resort)
